title: Utilization of CO2-captured poly(allylamine) as a polymer surfactant for nanoarchitecture production in a closed CO2 cycle
content:
RSC Sustain., 2024, 2,1837-1848
DOI: 10.1039/D4SU00121D, Paper

Eri Yoshida
In the closed loop of the CO2 cycle, poly(allylamine) (PAA) captures CO2 as carbonic acid in water and then undergoes partial ion exchange to convert into a polymer surfactant, which self-assembles into nanoarchitectures.
